metadata.synopsis: The head clerk is nervous and clearly worried about something. The player can convince him to tell them about his problems, as well as buy a bank pass to access the vaults belowground

34.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
34.text: Ah - if you don't mind, saer, I do believe our business is quite concluded, and I have other customers.
34.context: NodeContext: Politely trying to fob us off

42.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
42.text: Ah - if you don't mind, saer, I do believe you have your pass, and I have other customers. The vaults are just downstairs.
42.context: NodeContext: Tremulous, but firm - he and the other clerks are cowering at the back.

73.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
73.text: If you mean to rob us, be about it - but leave my staff be.
73.context: NodeContext: Tremulous, but firm - he and the other clerks are cowering at the back.

89.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
89.text: I beg your pardon, but I'm still searching for that missing item. I... I do believe we may have been robbed.
89.context: NodeContext: Spoken in undertones, not realising we're the robber

102.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
102.text: Welcome to the Counting House. I'm Head Clerk Meadhoney - how may the Fellowship of Financiers serve you?
102.context: NodeContext: Veneer of polite agreeableness, but should be showing slight hint of nerves. There's something unusual going on in the vaults today with your boss and a new customer, but you're trying to keep on keeping on.

9.speaker: Minsc
9.text: Do not fret, little banker. Minsc has no need of your services. Boo holds all our valuables in his little cheeks.
9.context: NodeContext: Non-plussed, terrified, just wants us to leave

53.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
53.context: NodeContext: Non-plussed, terrified, just wants us to leave

205.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
205.text: Ah. S-saer Stone Lord. Returning to... make another withdrawal?
205.context: NodeContext: Terrified - speaking to someone who just robbed your bank

169.speaker: Player
169.text: Do not fret, little banker. Minsc has no need of your services. Boo holds all our valuables in his little cheeks.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: You seem a little nervous, Saer Meadhoney. Had some difficult customers today?
100.context: NodeContext: Addressing a bank clerk with the theory that Minsc has passed by. Hesitating around calling him 'Stone Lord', but knowing it will probably help.

187.speaker: Jaheira
187.text: You seem a little nervous, Saer Meadhoney. Had some difficult customers today?
187.context: NodeContext: Addressing a bank clerk with the theory that Minsc has passed by. Hesitating around calling him 'Stone Lord', but knowing it will probably help.

8.speaker: Jaheira
8.text: One in particular calling himself the Stone Lord, perhaps?
8.context: NodeContext: A pause, then he relents - he'd been nervous of what's happening in the bank and is eager to sort it out.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: All right. Fine. The Head Banker may have just taken a customer by that name down into the vaults.
20.context: NodeContext: A pause, then he relents - he'd been nervous of what's happening in the bank and is eager to sort it out.

118.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
118.text: All right. Fine. The Head Banker may have just taken a customer by that name down into the vaults.
118.context: NodeContext: A pause, then he relents - he'd been nervous of what's happening in the bank and is eager to sort it out.

40.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
40.text: Rather large. Rather heavily armed - which is against regulations - but I'm sure the Head Banker knows what he's doing.
40.context: NodeContext: Warily describing Minsc being marched past security with the Head Banker - a heist in progress, he suspects. End of sentence is him putting a lid on his anxiety again - he's too proper to do anything about it.

117.speaker: Jaheira
117.text: I assure you. He does not. You're right to be nervous - but let us pass, and all will be well.
117.context: NodeContext: Licking lips, wants our help in dealing with the Stone Lord but needs to know before letting us down into the vaults

196.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
196.text: Eh, well... who is this Stone Lord to you?
196.context: NodeContext: Licking lips, wants our help in dealing with the Stone Lord but needs to know before letting us down into the vaults

125.speaker: Player
125.text: The absolute least of your problems if you don't shut up and let us pass.
125.context: NodeContext: Genuinely surprised - Minsc didn't seem the type (ie, he looked like a barbarian)

139.speaker: Player
139.text: A friend. He might do something stupid down there, but we can help.
139.context: NodeContext: Genuinely surprised - Minsc didn't seem the type (ie, he looked like a barbarian)

136.speaker: Player
136.text: A lord of Rashemen - and we are his servants. He's likely to pull his contract if we don't set up his banquet table soon.
136.context: NodeContext: Genuinely surprised - Minsc didn't seem the type (ie, he looked like a barbarian)

210.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
210.text: A lord in truth? Forgive me, he did not seem the type - or! I mean to say, he was most... down to earth.
210.context: NodeContext: Genuinely surprised - Minsc didn't seem the type (ie, he looked like a barbarian)

211.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
211.text: A lord in truth? Forgive me, he did not seem the type - or! I mean to say, he was most... down to earth.
211.context: NodeContext: Genuinely surprised - Minsc didn't seem the type (ie, he looked like a barbarian)

84.speaker: Jaheira
84.context: NodeContext: Nodding, talking himself around, eager to have a soltuion

199.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
199.text: It's most unusual, but... that explains why the Head Banker has dispensed with normal procedure. I suppose I can let you pass, then.
199.context: NodeContext: Nodding, talking himself around, eager to have a soltuion

19.text: No. No. This will not do. This House has catered to its share of lords. Your friend is... something else.
19.context: NodeContext: Was almost swayed, but snapping back to reality. He'll keep calm and carry on without our help, thanks very much.

191.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
191.text: No. No. This will not do. This House has catered to its share of lords. Your friend is... something else.
191.context: NodeContext: Was almost swayed, but snapping back to reality. He'll keep calm and carry on without our help, thanks very much.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: *A relaxed tone and easy smile - but the halfling's shifting gaze gives it away. Something has him rattled.*
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of clerk's eyes not fully meeting ours.

54.text: *A relaxed tone and easy smile - but the halfling's shifting gaze gives it away. Something has him rattled.*
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of clerk's eyes not fully meeting ours.

129.speaker: Narrator
129.text: *A relaxed tone and easy smile - but the halfling's shifting gaze gives it away. Something has him rattled.*
129.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of clerk's eyes not fully meeting ours.

122.speaker: Player
122.context: NodeContext: Poorly masking his concern - 'it's fine' is just as much to convince himself as you

207.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
207.text: Will this one start breaking bones like the Stone Lord? Hins' horned feet, I should have been a baker.

67.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
67.text: Will this one start breaking bones like the Stone Lord? Hins' horned feet, I should have been a baker.

201.speaker: Player
201.text: Remind me again where Head Banker Glitterbeard is?
201.context: NodeContext: Poorly masking his concern - 'it's fine' is just as much to convince himself as you

114.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
114.text: He's taken a new customer down to the vaults. A rather large and heavily armed fellow, but... I'm sure it's fine. We are just fine.
114.context: NodeContext: Poorly masking his concern - 'it's fine' is just as much to convince himself as you

69.speaker: Player
69.text: What strangeness? Tell me what's going on - I can help.
69.context: NodeContext: ruffled, put out by the player

97.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
97.text: Your help is not needed. Your compliance is. So please - account business only.
97.context: NodeContext: ruffled, put out by the player

200.text: Your help is not needed. Your compliance is. So please - account business only.
200.context: NodeContext: ruffled, put out by the player

70.text: Your help is not needed. Your compliance is. So please - account business only.
70.context: NodeContext: ruffled, put out by the player

101.speaker: Player
101.text: You seem agitated. Is everything all right?
101.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

213.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
213.text: Oh, fine. Fine. A rather large and heavily armed fellow has taken the Head Banker Glitterbeard below.
213.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

112.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
112.text: Oh, fine. Fine. A rather large and heavily armed fellow has taken the Head Banker Glitterbeard below.
112.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

179.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
179.text: He's... an unusual sort of customer. But the Head Banker said he'd handle it, so it's fine. I'm sure we're just fine.
179.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Let me help. I'll go and check on your Head Banker.
90.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

123.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
123.text: That would be most unusual. But then... so is our visitor.
123.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

148.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
148.text: That would be most unusual. But then... so is our visitor.
148.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

80.speaker: Player
80.text: That he is. But don't worry, we can handle him.
80.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

135.speaker: Jaheira
135.text: That he is. But don't worry, we can handle him.
135.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Very well. Show the guards this temporary vault pass. And should my superior ask, keep my name out of it.
18.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

76.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
76.text: Very well. Show the guards this temporary vault pass. And should my superior ask, keep my name out of it.
76.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

103.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
103.text: Ah. I fear... well, I seem to have misplaced the pass. Perhaps we are over-subscribed. Either way - so sorry to have wasted your time.
103.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

4.text: The Head Banker of the Counting House deals with all manner of clientele, no matter how colourful. He does not need your help.
4.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

94.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
94.text: The Head Banker of the Counting House deals with all manner of clientele, no matter how colourful. He does not need your help.
94.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

121.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
121.text: As Head Clerk, I am happy to assist you in opening an account. Otherwise...?
121.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I suppose I'll find another way down, then.
64.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

126.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
126.text: You are free to throw away your life in any way you choose.

140.speaker: Player
140.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

16.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
16.text: Splendid! New coin and customers always welcome.
16.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

206.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
206.text: We need only settle the matter of Waukeen's Wage. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
206.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

128.speaker: Player
128.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

167.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
167.text: A minor fee for new accounts. So Our Lady of Trade might bless this business venture.

130.speaker: Player
130.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

51.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
51.text: Waukeen's coin, most gratefully received. And in return - a pass to the vaults, and your own personal key. Strongbox Five.
51.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

58.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
58.text: As I mentioned, we have some... other clients carrying out a transaction below. I would ask for your discretion.

120.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
120.text: Lastly, I would ask for your discretion today. We have some... other clients visiting below.

91.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
91.text: You've only just joined us, so I'll clarify the service we offer. Security. And privacy.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: They mind their business, I'll mind mine.

81.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
81.text: Ah. I fear... well, I seem to have misplaced the pass. Perhaps we are over-subscribed. So sorry - but please do take your coin back.
81.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

5.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
5.text: Ah. I fear... well, I seem to have misplaced the vault key. Perhaps it's already been allocated to someone else. So sorry - but please do take your coin back.
5.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

165.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
165.context: NodeContext: Politely ending the conversation with us, the customer, to go back and look for the items he's missing (either a vault key or a bank pass he doesn't know we've stolen)

37.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
37.text: Ah. I fear... well, I seem to have misplaced key and vault pass both. Perhaps it's already been allocated to someone else. So sorry - but please do take your coin back.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: I've recently come into a large estate. Could I sign it against that as a guarantee instead?

203.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
203.text: Naturally. We serve the Gate's oldest families - not all have cash in hand. What kind of establishment would we be if we saw value in coin alone?

68.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
68.text: Could you provide the address of your property?

38.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
38.text: Oh, by the Coinmaiden! How, er, quaint. And the name of the manor?

202.speaker: Player
202.text: Bhaal. As in, the Lord of Murder.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: B-H-A-A-L. Er, it's an old family name.

47.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
47.text: Silly me - of course! Let me check our records...

30.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
30.text: I'm afraid your estate is not registered on the Sword Coast customs censuses - have you been paying your mansion taxes?

177.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
177.text: Or perhaps it isn't valued highly enough to be above the threshold.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: It is an illustrious household. We employ paid help!

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *You wonder how many years ago it was you last gave Sceleritas so much as a table scrap of your dinner, let alone any paycoin.*

145.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
145.text: There's a refugee labour crisis on. Any country merchant with half a copper could hire a fleet of butlers.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: The indignity! I'm heir to one of the oldest families in this city!

23.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
23.text: Then why not bring the gold for the account? Father not given out your allowance yet?

131.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
131.text: Kindly return with coin in hand. I'm sure that is well within the talents of one of your means.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: Fool! I will soon hold the treasures of the world over, as all tremble in stricken awe.

104.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
104.text: Do come back when you do!

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Did I say 'Bhaal'? I meant the 'Bowel' Temple.

105.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
105.text: Ah, I'm afraid we already have an entry by that name. A rather popular bathhouse in the sewers.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: It's not really a manor, it's more of a lair.

133.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
133.text: Unfortunately, we do not have a repayment plan available for 'lairs'.

150.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
150.text: We do tunnel insurance for mining business, and home vault maintenance. Those are the sole subterranean ventures the House will consider.

56.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
56.text: I can hardly enact a loan on your house if you won't tell me where it is.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: Do the Coinmaiden's followers not provide a discount for faithful folk?

173.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
173.text: Oh, you're a person of the cloth? I'm sorry, of course we can provide a discount. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I don't have that kind of money.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I want you to store my coin, not steal it.

181.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
181.text: You wish to patronise the Sword Coast's most eminent bank.

12.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
12.text: Might I suggest scratching some coppers together first?

144.speaker: Player
144.text: There is no door I cannot unlock - no room I cannot enter. I will find another way down.

193.speaker: Player
193.text: I'm something of a security expert. That sounds like a breach - why don't I go check?
193.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.A little worried as we were threatening him, but putting up a polite show -

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I wield magic with the ease of breathing - perhaps I could help? Maybe check on your Head Banker?
44.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.A little worried as we were threatening him, but putting up a polite show -

158.speaker: Player
158.text: I'm rather large and heavily armed myself. Why not let me check on your Head Banker, just to be safe?
158.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.A little worried as we were threatening him, but putting up a polite show -

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I can check on your banker. Your vaults are safe from me - I have no interest in gold.
35.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.A little worried as we were threatening him, but putting up a polite show -

138.speaker: Player
138.text: I'm rather heavily armed myself. I'll be heading down below, too.
138.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.A little worried as we were threatening him, but putting up a polite show -

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I'm armed and far more dangerous - so I'll see myself downstairs.
6.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.A little worried as we were threatening him, but putting up a polite show -

178.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
178.text: Ah, a threat? Our other visitor simply skipped straight to violence.
178.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.A little worried as we were threatening him, but putting up a polite show -

28.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
28.text: Ah, a threat? Our other visitor simply skipped straight to violence.
28.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.A little worried as we were threatening him, but putting up a polite show -

83.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
83.text: No need, I am convinced! Show the guards this temporary vault pass. And should my superior ask, keep my name out of it.
83.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.A little worried as we were threatening him, but putting up a polite show -

153.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
153.text: Ah. I fear... well, I seem to have misplaced the pass. Perhaps we are over-subscribed. So sorry - but I won't be able to help you today.
153.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.A little worried as we were threatening him, but putting up a polite show -

183.text: Do you know, I've quite heard my fill of threats today. They are weak currency, quite devalued.

110.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
110.text: Do you know, I've quite heard my fill of threats today. They are weak currency, quite devalued.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: And everything will stay fine. So long as you let me down into your vault.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Nothing is fine. This place is about to suffer a terrible curse - unless you let me down into the vault.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Tell me more about this large fellow.

172.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
172.text: Honestly, that about describes him. Over a certain size, well... you all begin to look the same. My eyesight, you see.

96.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
96.text: The Head Banker did seem to expect him - but he seemed frightened, too.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: It sounds like a robbery to me.

61.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
61.text: Our books stretch back to near the city's founding. No robbery has ever been recorded.

15.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
15.text: They also make no mention of Glitterbeard's stranger guests, but... I'm sure that's a separate matter entirely.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I want to open an account.

204.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
204.text: ...Of course! Forgive me, you have your own business to attend to, I'm sure.

212.text: Just fine. Eager to serve, any way I may.

176.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
176.text: Just fine. Eager to serve, any way I may.

190.speaker: Player
190.text: You seem ill at ease. I am a cleric, and well used to hearing strangers' woes. Are you well?

189.speaker: Player
189.text: You smile but your body language says otherwise. Is everything all right?

124.speaker: Player
124.text: You think too much! SHOUT YOUR WORRIES OUT. GO ON.

192.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
192.text: I will not shout, but if it will appease you - a rather large and heavily armed fellow has taken Head Banker Glitterbeard below.

174.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
174.text: I will not shout, but if it will appease you - a rather large and heavily armed fellow has taken Head Banker Glitterbeard below.

113.text: I beg your pardon - this is the house of the Lady of Trade, not a common tavern. So please - account business only.
113.context: NodeContext: ruffled, put out by the player

2.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
2.text: I beg your pardon - this is the house of the Lady of Trade, not a common tavern. So please - account business only.
2.context: NodeContext: ruffled, put out by the player

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I'm writing a ballad - 'The Bothered Banker'. Hearing what's on your mind would really help.
33.context: NodeContext: Perplexed, but relenting - he's a little nervous about the situation so willing to confide.

99.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
99.text: I can't imagine who would want to hear such a song, but... as you will. A rather large and heavily armed fellow has accompanied Head Banker Glitterbeard down to the vault.
99.context: NodeContext: Perplexed, but relenting - he's a little nervous about the situation so willing to confide.

78.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
78.text: I can't imagine who would want to hear such a song, but... as you will. A rather large and heavily armed fellow has accompanied Head Banker Glitterbeard down to the vault.
78.context: NodeContext: Perplexed, but relenting - he's a little nervous about the situation so willing to confide.

27.text: You're writing a what? A ballad?

162.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
162.text: You're writing a what? A ballad?

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Who is this Stone Lord that has you worried?
43.context: NodeContext: Nervous, relenting to tell us some information we've been pressing for

137.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
137.context: NodeContext: Nervous, relenting to tell us some information we've been pressing for

127.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
127.text: All right, fine! A rather large and heavily armed fellow has taken Head Banker Glitterbeard below. He used that name.
127.context: NodeContext: Nervous, relenting to tell us some information we've been pressing for

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I'm not a customer. I'm here because Nine-Fingers is planning something in your vault.

198.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
198.text: A name of that repute has nothing to do with an honest banking house, I assure you.

10.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
10.text: We've had quite enough strangeness for one day, my thanks. By which I only mean -

194.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
194.text: If you have no business here... well. You have no business here.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: I'm here on behalf of our mutual employer - Nine-Fingers Keene?

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Head Banker Glitterbeard - you know he's involved with the Guild, yes?

55.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
55.text: I have proudly served this institution for many, many years. I open, I close, and I am well-paid for it.

31.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
31.text: But there are still... certain matters... that I am not paid to handle. That is all I will say on the matter.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I need access to your vaults.

209.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
209.text: Ah! Then you'll need a vault pass.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: I would like to open an account.

106.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
106.context: NodeContext: Frightened but polite, doesn't want to set us off again

156.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
156.text: If you wish to open an account, you are more than welcome. Otherwise, I do have work to do.
156.context: NodeContext: Frightened but polite, doesn't want to set us off again

26.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
26.text: I would like to open an account.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: I would like to open an account.

171.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
171.text: The Stone Lord - you are with him...? If you could keep him from cracking any more of my guard's skulls, I would be most obliged.
171.context: NodeContext: Frightened but polite, doesn't want to set us off again
